page.title: 20OLD AND NEW IN CHURCHDOWN
page.content: There are several different building types in Churchdown,both old houses and new estates.An example of an original village house is situated on the green.It dates from 1581 and is black and white and is made mainly of "wattle and daub",although some of the newer parts are built with bricks.The roof was originally thatched but is now tarred and tiled.It contains 8 rooms and has approx. a quarter of an acre of land around it. An example of a modern estate house is situated on Brookfield Road opposite Chosen Hill School.It was built in 1984 and is built entirely of bricks.Its roof is pitched with tiles.It is fairly large with 12 rooms consisting of 4 bedrooms ,a large kitchen plus other rooms.
